issue.title: Always use UNC (long) paths on Windows.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
EDIT: Can be merged (after review)

Paths in local file systems are now all absolute. 

Changing "\" to "/" prior to that makes "C:\" change to "C:/", which is incorrectly interpreted as _current directory_ by `filepath.Abs()`, so we cannot use `filepath.toSlash()` before we make the path absolute.

Fixes #124 

TO REVIEW: `filepath.ToSlash()` is removed for ALL filesystems, so they will be served the raw path. This means that "ACD:\filedir\" is no longer changed to "ACD:/filedir/", but that should be handled by each FS, if we keep it as is.

issue.title: windows: files over 256 chars path

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi

On windows file system if a file contains on Is path more than 256 characters the file Is not created on gdrive

Regards

issue.title: fatal error: sync: unlock of unlocked mutex on mounted encrypted union of Google Drives

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I have rclone mouting an encrypted union of Google Drives. A main account with shared team drives that other accounts has been given access to and used to balance writes to stretch the upload quota limit. This has worked fine for a long time but recently it started failing after a while.

The mount is mounted using

```
/usr/bin/rclone mount \
--allow-other \
--file-perms 0777 \
--dir-perms 0777 \
--drive-server-side-across-configs \
# Google Drive is a polling remote so this value can be set very high and any changes are detected via polling.
--dir-cache-time 1000h \
--attr-timeout 1000h \
--vfs-read-chunk-size 128M \
--vfs-read-chunk-size-limit off \
--drive-skip-gdocs \
--timeout 1h \
--tpslimit 10 \
--tpslimit-burst 10 \
--transfers 24 \
--drive-chunk-size="128M" \
# Reduce the poll interval down to 15 seconds as this makes changes appear faster
--poll-interval 15s \
# This sets up the remote control daemon so you can issue rc commands locally
--rc \
# This is the default port it runs on
--rc-addr :5576 \
# no-auth is used as no one else uses my server and it is not a shared seedbox
--rc-no-auth \
# The local disk used for caching
--cache-dir=/dev/shm/gdrive-shared-union-encrypted/vfs \
# This is used for caching files to local disk for streaming
--vfs-cache-mode full \
# This limits the cache size to the value below
--vfs-cache-max-size 15G \
# This limits the age in the cache if the size is reached and it removes the oldest files first
--vfs-cache-max-age 1h \
"my-gdrive-shared-union-encrypted:" \
"/mnt/gdrive"
```

Config of the remotes are

```
[my-gdrive-shared-union]
type = union
scope = drive
root_folder_id =
upstreams = my-gdrive:/encrypted my-gdrive-shared: my-gdrive-shared-c1: my-gdrive-shared-c2: my-gdrive-shared-c3:
search_policy = ff
create_policy = rand
action_policy = rand

[my-gdrive]
type = drive
client_id = *redacted*
client_secret = *redacted*
scope = drive
token = *redacted*
root_folder_id = *redacted*
server_side_across_configs = true

[my-gdrive-encrypted]
type = crypt
remote = my-gdrive:/encrypted
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = *redacted*
password2 = *redacted*
server_side_across_configs = true

[my-gdrive-shared-union-encrypted]
type = crypt
remote = my-gdrive-shared-union:
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = *redacted*
password2 = *redacted*

[my-gdrive-shared]
type = drive
client_id = *redacted*
client_secret = *redacted*
scope = drive
token = *redacted*
team_drive = *redacted*
root_folder_id =
server_side_across_configs = true

[my-gdrive-shared-c1]
type = drive
client_id = *redacted*
client_secret = *redacted*
scope = drive
token = *redacted*
team_drive = *redacted*
root_folder_id =
server_side_across_configs = true

[my-gdrive-shared-c2]
type = drive
client_id = *redacted*
client_secret = *redacted*
scope = drive
token = *redacted*
team_drive = *redacted*
root_folder_id =
server_side_across_configs = true

[my-gdrive-shared-c3]
type = drive
client_id = *redacted*
client_secret = *redacted*
scope = drive
token = *redacted*
team_drive = *redacted*
root_folder_id =
server_side_across_configs = true
```

The log file contains what looks like a call trace with references to go functions.

```
fatal error: sync: unlock of unlocked mutex

        bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:1418 +0xdb7 fp=0xc00146fde0 sp=0xc00146fae0 pc=0x14d3397

```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.58.1
- os/version: ubuntu 20.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.4.0-110-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.17.9
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux daserver 5.4.0-110-generic #124-Ubuntu SMP Thu Apr 14 19:46:19 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Google Drive through an rclone union

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Mounted rclone union fails after a while and directory can't be listed, uploaded to etc. Sais the endpoint isn't connected anymore.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone -vv copy TESTFILE my-gdrive-shared-union-encrypted:
```

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
